title: Older brother of 10-year-old Aurora boy who was fatally shot arrested in case
content:
The older brother of a 10-year-old who fatally shot himself in Aurora last weekend has been arrested in the case.
The brother, 17, was arrested on suspicion of negligent child abuse resulting in death, a felony, according to an Aurora Police Department media release.
He is being held on a $10,000 bond at the LINK Juvenile Assessment Center in Adams County, police said.
Aurora police were called about 9:45 p.m. Friday to the Nordic Arms apartments at 1575 Galena St., after a report of shots being fired and found the boy, Anthony Jaliel Lujan Hemmings, with a gunshot wound. He was pronounced dead at the scene.
Police are still investigating, but family members said they believe the boy died from an accidental, self-inflicted gunshot wound. They believe he found the gun, wrapped in cloth and sitting on top of a shelf.
Anyone with information about this case is asked to call Detective Bob Wesner with the crimes against children unit at 303-739-6093.
Editor’s note: This story has been updated to reflect that the arrested brother has been charged as a juvenile.
